intro: Adenostephanus bleasdalii, commonly known as the Bleasdale's rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color, blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
